column1: '''''anga''''' is a noun meaning "iron" in [[Quenya]].<ref name="Names">{{App
column2: Letters}}, Note, ''The names of the letters''</ref>

left]]''Anga'' is also the name in Quenya of the seventh letter of the [[Tengwar]] alphabet.<ref name="Names"/>  It is the third letter of the second grade or [[Tyellë]], which contains "voiced stops" and it is the second letter in the third series of consonants, which in Quenya and [[Sindarin]] was the ''k''-series, the ''[[Calmatéma]]''.<ref name="Letters">{{App
column3: Letters}}</ref>  In the standard spelling of Quenya ''Anga'' represents '''NG''',<ref>{{App
column4: Letters}}, Note</ref> while in [[Sindarin]] this letter represents '''G'''.  In [[Westron]], the third series is used for a variety of consonantal sounds and this letter represents '''J'''.<ref name="Letters"/>  The Westron name for this letter is '''''Jé'''''.<ref>See [[Westron Tengwar]].</ref>

column1: At the end of the second week in [[September]], {{TA
column3: TA}}</ref> [[Gandalf]] rode through [[Hobbiton]] in a cart.  Halting at [[Bag End]] he unloaded bundles of firewords, all of them inscribed with the tengwa ''Anga''.  It was his initial but the hobbit-children who had followed his cart thought the letter stood for "Grand!"<ref>{{FR

column1: The word derives from the [[Primitive Quendian]] [[Sundocarme
